bill_title: authorize the use of certain addresses by persons signing petitions.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the use of certain addresses by persons signing petitions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. For any petition circulated pursuant to the South Dakota Codified Laws that requires the signer to specify his or her place of residence, a nursing home address, for any person who resides in the nursing home, and a student residence hall address, for any person who resides in the residence hall, is valid and sufficient to meet the requirement to specify the place of residence if the address specified on the petition coincides with the residence under which the signer is registered to vote. A street address is not required for any such nursing home address or residence hall address. Section 2. On any petition circulated pursuant to the South Dakota Codified Laws, a person may sign the petition using the title, Mrs., combined with the name of the person's husband if this form of the signer's name coincides with the name under which the signer is registered to vote. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
